issue.title: [CF 419] Additional triggers for animations
issue.body:
Could you make it possible to trigger an animation based on another icon being shown? I'm trying to give my rotation icon an activation border when I should cast Heroic Strike aswell as the flashing animation when I should cast Inner Rage. However there aren't any obvious methods to accomplish this. I have tried creating additional metaicons with animations to override my main metaicon, but this is already causing quirky behaviour from the get-go, aswell as being incredibly messy and probably also not very efficient for the CPU to handle.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #419 | Raw

comments.body:
Also, while playing around with animations, I noticed the color picker for the flash animation has 0% opacity at the top, where + is, and 100% opacity at the bottom, where - is. Isn't this the opposite from the way this usually works?


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

I was wondering the same thing. I looked at the code, and Ace3 configs correct it, but the color picker for animations doesn't use Ace3, so it wasn't switched. I'll switch it.

I will see what I can do for an "On Icon Show" event

Oops. I changed the way events fire shortly after implementing this, but forgot to change OnIconShow and OnIconHide.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Should be working now.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

I'm not sure how many different things are misfiring here, since it's all very confusing. One thing I can say for sure is this: metaicons will stop a running animation when the active subicon switches. Note: the animation is attached to the metaicon, not one of the subicons.

Also, animations triggered by the "icon show"-event don't end when the icon is hidden. (presumably animations triggered by "icon hide" also don't end when the icon becomes shown.)

Edited Feb 2, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

That is actually "intended". Because of the way that meta icons inherit settings, when a meta icon inherits an icon that is playing an animation, it is the same (code-wise) as the meta icon playing that animation.

The fact that a meta icon will clear animations that originated on the meta icon when the icon being checked changes is an unforeseen consequence of this, though, and I will get it fixed tomorrow.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

It should be working properly now.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
